raw_text: Model 2, and found that when the decoder requested a smoothed estimate involving a bigram when testing on held-out data, it only received an estimate that made use of bi lexical statistics a mere 1.49% of the time (Bikel, 2004)
clean_text: Subsequently, we duplicated Gildea's experiment with a complete emulation of Collins' Model 2, and found that when the decoder requested a smoothed estimate involving a bigram when testing on held-out data, it only received an estimate that made use of bilexical statistics a mere 1.49% of the time (Bikel, 2004).

citing_paper_authors: Daniel M., Bikel
raw_text: The results of (Bikel, 2004) suggested that the power of Collins-style parsing models did not 6None of the differences between the Model 2? emulation results and the reduced model results is statistically significant
clean_text: The results of (Bikel, 2004) suggested that the power of Collins-style parsing models did not lie primarily with the use of bilexical dependencies as was once thought, but in lexico-structural dependencies, that is, predicting syntactic structures conditioning on head words.
